title: Engage Us!
bodyStorage:
General

The Fidelity Charitable DevOps Team is responsible for the overall continuous integration and continuous delivery process, Maintaining and Administrating Environments and infrastructure within Fidelity Charitable. We support customers of Jenkins, GitHub and Fidelity Charitable Environments . We fully support our continuous delivery pipeline for DIT, TEST, QA, and Prod.


If you're not a customer or need to engage us for the first time please email us at NCSEnvSupp@fmr.com

Opening a JIRA Request

Before Opening a JIRA
  • Please read the  FAQs for self help
  • Visit the following document to determine which type of ticket to enter.
  • Visit the consultation document.
  • Confirm the code that is deployed on the given environment – is this the same branch you are testing against and expect the change to work?
  • Have all the changes related to are deployed in the environment – like DB Changes, NGINX rules, any udeploy setting changes
  • Make sure to look at the logs to confirm this is not the issue with the code – engage the developer on the team to confirm this if you are not sure where to look at

Please use the smart intake process to create tickets. If your ticket does not fall into one of the smart intake categories please use this link: https://jira.fmr.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=30101233&projectKey=NCSDEVOPS

Tips for Creating a JIRA
  • Title – make sure you state the issue that is happening and the environment as part of this
  • Description – make sure to include following things; Environment, Steps to Reproduce the issue, Expected Behavior, Observed Behavior, Screenshot of Issue, DataDog/Logs you have looked at
  • Do Not Clone other tickets as they may miss the triage process and take longer
  • Do not include any Assignee or Priorities to the ticket because request will got through a triage process and that step is done at that time


What to Expect Once a Ticket is Opened

There is a Triage Meeting once each business day at 9:15am (ET). Tickets will be discussed and prioritized at this meeting. At this point tickets will be flagged for more information or assigned to someone with a due date and label.

If you need a ticket addressed before the next triage meeting please contact one of the following:

  •  
  •  
  •  
  •  
  •  

Jira Workflow

When a Jira ticket is opened it will follow the below workflow

To Do → Triage → In Progress → Validation → Done


To Do: where your request will land

Triage: At the triage phase our engineers will review the information, collect all the required/missing information from users 

In Progress: Based on the priority and workload, the request will be assigned to one of the engineer and he/she will start working on the issue

Validation: The ticket is done and awaiting validation from the customer. Will be closed if no response

Done: Once the task is complete, the request will be marked Done(Resolved/Closed)
